poem:
**Ursids in the Quiet Sky**

The night's deep breath  
echoes silence across  
a chapel of darkness,  
where cold stars gather  
in whispered petitions.  
Blessed the unclad sky,  
for meteors unfurl  
from the heavens' seam,  
gracing our solitude  
with brief, flaming grace—  
a celestial psalm  
in the still grip  
of winter's clasp.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starwatch: Ursids meteor shower to appear in largely dark sky Another week, another meteor shower. Last week it was the highly reliable Geminids meteor shower, this week it is the lesser shower known as the Ursids. Whereas the Geminids were disrupted by the presence of a full moon, the Ursids will appear in a largely dark sky. Only after midnight will the moon, now progressed to its last quarter phase, appear above the horizon. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
